position.marginalia_text: Prestons, and Harveys familiar conference concerning the first decad of Liuie: and of Machiauels politique discourses upon this decad. Owr cheife autours for direction and resolution, were non manie, but essentiall, and for the most part iudicious. Especially Aristotle and Bodine for groundes of policie: Sansavino annd Danaeus for aphorismes: Patritius and Plutarch for discourse: Hotoman and Maranta for lawe; sumtime Vigelius and excellent Hopper[us] [illegible]. Thowgh otherwhiles wee had the Censures of Danaeus and Hotoman in suspicion: the one for sum irregular rules, [illegible] Ephorismes, then Aphorismes: the other for his peremptorie and almost seditious Francogallia. Dange[rous]

[illegible . . .] and flatt opposite to the imperiall ciuil lawe of the prudent, ualorous, and reputed, iust Romans. Such were owr resolutions upon Liuie, owre special notes, and particular obseruations, both moral, politique, militarie, stratagematical, and other of anie worth or importance, wee committed to writing.
